top_categories.workout_context: Sasquatch Duro’s mountain gravel, coast range demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Sasquatch Duro rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Sasquatch Duro isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Sasquatch Duro when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Sasquatch Duro. Make this intensity feel like home.
Sasquatch Duro’s coast range mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Sasquatch Duro’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Sasquatch Duro — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Sasquatch Duro’s coast range mountain gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Sasquatch Duro’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Sasquatch Duro — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on coast range mountain gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Sasquatch Duro — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Sasquatch Duro’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Sasquatch Duro. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Sasquatch Duro requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on coast range mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: mountain gravel, coast range, forest roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 62 miles of coast range mountain gravel in Carlton, Oregon.
